answers.answer: Hi!The simplest reason could be faulty footwear. Even if the child does not have any apparent problems, if he has ‘hot heels’ then the following conditions should be looked into: diabetes, Sjogren’s syndrome, peripheral neuropathies, hypothyroidism, lupus, peripheral artery disease, sarcoidosis, and high blood pressure. Do discuss this with your doctor. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you.
